Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: An elementary understanding of the language in a very short amount of time.
You practice speaking the language a lot, which is very good.
If you put in the effort, you get the real foundations of the language.
I learned basic vocabulary and verbs in Spanish that have helped me form cohesive sentences and speak the language.
I gained a beginner level understanding of the spanish language.
How to speak spanish and a little about Spanish culture.
I gained a basic understanding of simple Spanish grammar and learned a solid basis of vocabulary.
Spanish Vocabulary and practicing Spanish accent and pronunciation
I gained a lot of practice in introductory Spanish and learned a whole lot of the language. I had practice speaking, writing, and reading and it was fun.
I know there are spanish tutors, but they can only meet with each student for a total of 10 hours throughout the semester. I dont believe this is enough for a language.
strength is that the teacher encourages everyone to participate.

Strengths: Taught very well (get Valle if you can, she's incredible), reasonably paced, reasonably difficult
Weaknesses: None really

I think the course was well structured. The textbook was extremely helpful. I dont think the course packet was necessary, since I felt we did not use it much nor did it contribute to me learning the language better.
I really enjoyed how interactive this class was, and it forced me to be engaged and prepared for each day of class.
This course was very well taught and quite enjoyable. It could be improved by more support in listening exercises.

Strengths would be the teacher and its a very small class which encourages talking
Weakness would be the VHL

Strengths was that I thoroughly enjoyed the course because it was at a good level for me. I didn't have a weakness because I liked my partner in class very much, and the class had a very fun atmosphere which is important for something as foreign as a foreign language.
It is alot of work, but you get to learn Spanish very well.
Yes.
Yes if you want to learn Spanish. Definitely not an incredibly difficult course. Great to take in your first semester of freshman year.
Yes, I would recommend because it is a good introduction course to the language.
If a student has any interest in spanish, I highly recommend this course.
Yes, I feel very confident in my spanish-speaking skills currently.
Yes, SPAN 110 was fantastic and engaging.
Yes, very fun

Yes, I think it is very useful to learn another language, especially Spanish. This is a good way to see if you would like to pursue language further at this college, but it is also a lot of effort because the class is everyday and we moved through a lot of material quickly.
